snippet: Prime Minister Mario Monti of Italy was considered something of a white knight when he took office, but as he prepares to leave he is less beloved.
abstract: Rome Journal; Italian Prime Min Mario Monti took office as white knight with mandate to make tough decisions needed to set country right, but critics say he has failed to carry out necessary changes, leaving legacy more of austerity than growth.

byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo and Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Mario Monti of Italy was considered something of a white knight when he took office, but as he prepares to leave he is less beloved.

headline.seo: As Mario Monti Prepares to Step Down, Italians Express Disappointment
headline.main: As a Premier Prepares to Depart, the Talk Is of Lost Opportunities
headline.print_headline: As a Premier Prepares to Depart, The Talk Is of Lost Opportunities
